Questionnaire.QuestionnaireIntroduction:
The Health-Related Stress Inventory (HRSI) is a self-report questionnaire designed to assess stress levels related to health, lifestyle, and daily responsibilities. 

It helps individuals identify sources of stress and understand how stress impacts their physical and mental well-being.
Questionnaire.QuestionnaireDescription: Assess your current stress levels and how they affect your daily life.
Questions: I feel tense or 'wound up'.
I find it hard to relax.
I get upset easily or feel impatient.
I feel overwhelmed by responsibilities.
I struggle to focus due to stress.
I feel anxious about my health.
I have trouble sleeping because of stress.
I feel irritable or moody.
I experience headaches or physical tension.
I feel under pressure from work or study.
I worry excessively about the future.
I feel mentally exhausted.
I find it hard to enjoy leisure activities.
I notice my stress affecting relationships.
I feel a lack of control over my daily life.
I have difficulty managing multiple tasks.
I feel nervous in social situations.
I feel fatigued even after rest.
I experience physical symptoms like stomach upset.
I feel that stress impacts my decision-making.
